item.title: Manager, Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is currently recruiting for the exciting role of Manager, Analytics. In this role, you will work directly with Product and Marketing business partners to fulfill the following critical roles:

  • Support information-based business decisions by identifying, understanding, capturing, organizing, presenting, and disseminating data trends.
  • Work with business partners to grow profitable relationships with our clients and create sustainable value for RBC shareholders.

What will you do?

  • Participate in strategy meetings to provide input, gather and document business requirements, and help formulate analytical framework.
  • Manage the process of defining RBC product universe, specifying success measures, testing hypotheses, and communicating value-added observations towards refined strategy and effective implementation of win-win solutions.
  • Bring data analyses to bear on the development of RBC product branding.
  • Seek out new ways to engineer and manufacture best-in-class standard reports to showcase insights and support tactics, participate actively in self and peer development relating to financial products, operational processes, relationship management, and technology enhancement.
  • Increase the standardization and efficiency of the daily/ monthly/ quarterly/ annual reporting.
  • Influence the approach to answering business questions with deep RBC product insights.
  • Manage day-to-day workflow and negotiate realistic timelines. Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to.
  • Learn and apply new businesses, techniques, and ideas.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Solid working experience with very large relational databases and working experience with multiple querying tools such as native SQL, SAS, BI/Query, Queryman.
  • Proven technical experience with Tableau (desktop and server), UNIX and Windows integrated environments and ability to learn a new software or computer language in a short period of time.
  • Advanced SAS programming dealing with large data sets.
  • Attention to detail and applied data validation mechanisms.
  • At least 3 years working experience with financial products and services and their corresponding data.
  • Minimum successfully-completed undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or other quantitative discipline.

Nice-to-have:

  • Knowledge of Teradata or DB2 is definite asset.
  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment.
  • Experience with developing reports using OLAP tools.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-04-03

Application Deadline:

2023-04-18

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

item.title: Data Analytics Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Analyst

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms.  Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s).  Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit.  Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions.  Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

What will you do?

Analytics Lab Support

  • Assist in the creation and maintenance of foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors.

Business Case Development and Adoption Support

  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.

Technological use and Reuse

  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team.
  • Support global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis.

Leadership & People Development

  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.

What do you need to succeed?

Overall

  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • Strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Knowledge of auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.

Technical experience:

  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Working knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Working knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Proficient data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrates they have successfully worked in inclusive and diverse work teams
  • Proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities; across borders and cultures
  • Experience working as a team member on a special project, over an extended period of time

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $65,000 - $105,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals. These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-01-12-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-03-07-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Salesforce CRM Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Salesforce CRM Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Senior Salesforce CRM Analytics is responsible for leading our Salesforce platform for Advisors, Associates and other Business Groups in terms of org configuration, analytics, reporting and support for RBC Wealth Management Canada. As Salesforce is a critical application for RBC Wealth Management Canada, the purpose of this role will to help drive the roadmap of Salesforce so that our advisors can continue to efficiently manage their Client relationships.

Reporting to the Head, Relationship Management Solutions, this role is accountable for being a key contributing member of the RBC Wealth Canada management Salesforce Center of Excellence (COE).  This role acts as the lead senior administrator across our Financial Services Cloud (FSC) and CRM Analytics implementations which are all Lightning orgs and we are driving the cutting edge of Salesforce innovation.

What you will be doing?

  • Lead on CRM analytics (Tableau) for all Dashboards, reporting for Head office, regional, branch and advisor teams
  • Lead Advisor Desktop roadmap/enhancements by developing customized solutions within the Salesforce platform to support critical business functions and meet project objectives, client requirements and company goals
  • Lead application design sessions while consulting with all company stake-holders on new requirements and optimization of existing capabilities on the Salesforce platform
  • Lead collaboration with the IT Team on the implementation of change management best practices
  • Lead and communicate operational procedures and best practices with CRM analytics
  • Proactively identify and convey timely Salesforce-related information to our employees
  • Effectively lead communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and business partners using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close.  Resolves conflicts/issues of medium complexity and escalates others as appropriate
  • Actively participate in weekly project status meetings and ensure assigned tasks are completed on time to support project deliverables

Must Have

  • 5+ years Salesforce Admin experience (org size over 2000 users)
  • Bachelor’s Degree in General Business or Economics or Finance or Accounting or Mathematics
  • Minimum Salesforce Certifications - Salesforce Certified Admin, Salesforce Certified Advanced Admin, Salesforce Certified Platform App Builder
  • Strong knowledge of Financial Services Cloud & Einstein
  • Fully versed and knowledge of CRM Analytics (Tableau)
  • Hands on experience with Salesforce Automation tools as Process Builder, Visual Flows, Approval Processes

Nice to Have

  • Experience working with different Business groups to understand their current processes and recommend designs using the Salesforce platform to help improve efficiencies
  • Collaborated with other team members and developers to build a scalable solution using Salesforce

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, including progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Opportunity for career development within RBC

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

Canada

item.title: Manager, Enterprise Partnerships Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Enterprise Partnerships Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will drive the analytics agenda that support merchant partnerships and engagement in the Loyalty Portfolio Management & Analytics (LPM&A) organization. You will leverage extensive datasets across multiple data sources as well as advanced analytical tools to deliver meaningful analysis and insights that inform business decisions.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for addressing the analytics needs of internal stakeholders and external partners including creating business cases and developing performance reporting and dashboarding.

  • Lead internal stakeholder consultation end-to-end from assessing data needs, extracting data, analysis, translating data into insights and developing actionable recommendations.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Business Development, Relationship Management, Offers Execution to drive project outcomes.

  • Identify opportunities for data automation, templating and process improvements.

  • Project manage and prioritize requests independently, escalate where appropriate.

  • Work through and reduce ambiguity.

  • Demonstrate maturity in business judgment and decision making.

What do you need to succeed?

  • Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint

  • Proficiency and hands-on experience with SQL, SAS, Tableau, ThinkCell

  • Results oriented with the ability to produce high quality output that meets project timelines

  • Translate data into actionable insights and recommendations

  • Strong communication and presentation skills, effectively explain complex analytics to a variety of audiences

  • Ability to work with large and complex data sets

  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail

  • Work in a fast pace and matrix organization with a focus on managing multiple priorities

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Manager, Risk Analytics – Counterparty Credit Risk Innovative Analytics ( 6 Months Contract)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Risk Analytics – Counterparty Credit Risk Innovative Analytics ( 6 Months Contract)

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Our team is focused on the design and deployment of capabilities that enable the end-to-end transformation of our Capital Markets’ Counterparty Credit Risk reporting and analytic metrics, building and leading with technologies that put advanced analytic and AI practices at the forefront.

We are a team of 30+ resilient, collaborative people with strong backgrounds in both risk management and data analytic, delivering trusted data and analytic capabilities to support top of the house Counterparty Credit Risk Analytic function for RBC Capital markets operations.

Our main goal is building a future-proof tech stack with modern, flexible architecture that is reusable across different internal channels. In this role, you will join a newly formed Advanced Analytic Team that embraces innovation and is excited to bring a fresh perspective into the design, enhancement and deployment of a state of the art risk analytic platform.

What will you do?

As the Manager in Innovative Analytics Team, you will play a key role in contributing to continuous research, design and delivery of an advanced multi-disciplined risk analytic platform within the RBC Capital Markets Counterparty Credit Risk Management Team.

Nurturing culture and facilitating learning and knowledge sharing will be second nature to you as well as applying your technical know-how to ensure that the Innovative Analytic team is on the leading edge of technical delivery practices. You’ll have the tools and support needed to achieve extraordinary results that make a significant impact extending beyond the boundaries of traditional technology roles. Ideas start here – and you will build great technology.

If you’re a hands-on technical expert with proven experience operating within high-performing teams, are continuously learning, and excited to collaborate with those around you—we have a spot for you on our team.

  • Develop a thorough understanding of the current state of CCR analytic frameworks, end-to-end CCR metric generation processes and their connection with various upstream source systems.
  • Contribute to the research, development and implementation of new mathematical models for calculating various CCR measures. Considerable amount of creative, innovative & analytical thinking and problem solving is required.
  • Demonstrate exceptional communication skills (written and oral) by synthesizing key messages across distinct domains into a coherent action plan.
  • Leverage data analysis, querying and data exploration knowledge on CCR’s diverse number of data sources to perform statistical analysis, build machine learning models and deploy production-grade solutions for identifying insights and opportunities.
  • Become an expert in understanding CCR Innovative Analytics Team’s exiting libraries, leverage them to support delivery of new initiatives in collaboration with various CCR teams and lead KT sessions when required.
  • Partner with and support other teams as required; there are many teams, yet we are one team.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Graduate degree in STEM fields; double-major in Economics/Finance/Business and STEM. Strong grasp of fundamentals in statistics (hypothesis testing, regression, inference, and time series) and one of the key risk pillars (market, credit or liquidity).
  • Exceptional development expertise in Python programming writing production-grade code. Expertise with object-oriented and event-driven architecture (OOAD & SOLID principles) and Spark frameworks.
  • Strong data profiling, cleaning, engineering, mining and technical documentation skills; SQL/Data Stores: SQL, PostgreSQL, S3, HDFS and SparkQL.
  • Hands on experience with system configuration and DevOps tools (Jira, Git, GitHub and Confluence).
  • Self-starter with excellent communication skills, with proven ability to grow and mentor more junior technical professionals.

Nice-to-have

  • Experience developing interactive and sophisticated dashboards that communicate complex data insights to a diverse set business stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with building dashboards using Plotly and Dash in Python is an asset.
  • Experience with Airflow, graph databases, Jupyter Notebooks, other ML-related technologies.
  • Familiarity running distributed ML workloads in cluster orchestrated environments.
  • Experience with HTML, CSS and Web Development would be an asset.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients.

Job Summary

As the Manager in Innovative Analytics Team, you will play a key role in contributing to continuous research, design and delivery of an advanced multi-disciplined risk analytic platform within the RBC Capital Markets Counterparty Credit Risk Management Team.

Your responsibilities will not be limited to, leveraging data analysis, querying and data exploration knowledge on CCR’s diverse number of data sources to perform statistical analysis, build machine learning models and deploy production-grade solutions for identifying insights and opportunities

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

item.title: Lead Ecosystem Data Analytics Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Ecosystem Data Analytics Engineer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Senior Analytics Ecosystem Data Engineer will provide technical insight, hands-on development and data governance best practices for Internal Audit. This role is a leadership role targeted to increase the adoption of the IA Analytics Ecosystem and Data Products. This role also contributes to IA data strategy and best practices definition within area of Data Analytics, Data Management and Data Governance standards.

What will you do?

  • Partner with Audit Platform leads, data scientists, product managers and engineers to design, develop and deploy data solutions within the IA Ecosystem
  • Provide ongoing support for analytics processes in production on IA Ecosystem to promote operational safety and soundness and maintain end user satisfaction
  • Lead, Manage and Influence IA Ecosystem architecture capabilities and design decisions during the product development cycle to ensure technical development standards are being met and best practices are being followed
  • Active development within Data Engineering stack for a given initiative (UI, mid-tier, and back-end services) working on medium to high complexity solutions, frameworks and platforms
  • Work with large data sets, visualize end product and understand optimum processes to extract data and present in a solution which is understood and relevant to the business end user
  • Work with change management owners to identify change impact, risks, and mitigation strategies. Ensure that the approved plan is supported within the team, with stakeholders, and affected employees, and ensure that escalations are handled appropriately according to the approved plan
  • Strong collaboration and stake holder management; providing data and analytics solution advise to the audit business groups for relevant domain/portfolio

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 4+ years’ experience in backend development expertise using Python, ETL tooling (Dataiku, Datastage)
  • 4+ years’ experience in development with traditional database technology (i.e. SQL, Hadoop)
  • Strong experience with data visualization and reporting tools – e.g. Tableau
  • Strong expertise in Data Platforms, developing and managing data pipelines
  • Expertise with tools such as GitHub, as well as software development  and change management processes to manage implementation of centralized code and software releases

Nice-to-have 

  • 4-Year Undergraduate STEM degree (e.g. B.Com., B. Math, B.Sc, P. Eng.)
  • Experience in developing applications using JavaScript frameworks such as Vue, React or Angular.
  • Strong knowledge for creation of automated unit tests, integration, end-to-end testing and DevOps practices (E.g. CI/CD).

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization
  • This is a hybrid opportunity

#LI-Hybrid

Job Summary

The Senior Analytics Ecosystem Engineer will provide technical insight, hands-on development and data governance best practices for Internal Audit. This role is a leadership role targeted to increase the adoption of the IA Analytics Ecosystem and Data Products. This role also contributes to IA data strategy and best practices definition within area of Data Analytics, Data Management and Data Governance standards. Supports the development and maintenance of scalable data stores that supply big data in forms needed for business analysis. Applies extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.title: Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a member of EPM team and a dynamic group of technical specialists, The job involves leading the development, design, configuring and support of the financial models in line with industry best practices while collaborating with Business stakeholders and extended Finance teams. EPM technical specialists focuses on providing enterprise class design and solutions in the space of planning, budgeting, forecasting, allocations and financial consolidation to their finance partners.

What will you do?

  • Drive Implementation and lead development and technical efforts for EPM using IBM Suite of products.
  • Design innovative solution using best practices and customizing for the business specific needs.
  • Make the granular design decisions around acquiring, loading data, coding principles.
  • Be a hands-on SME advising, implementing, testing and training.
  • Communicate timely and accurate updates on the various initiatives, update on any risks following the set protocols.
  • Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a robust solutions meeting client’s specifications.
  • Mentor. You will support and mentor the developers and support teams.
  • Develops, codes, documents and executes unit test, system, integration and acceptance test for functions of high complexity.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have:

  • Developer experience in any one of the toolsets like IBM Planning Analytics / TM1, Anaplan, Oracle Hyperion, SAP BPC
  • Strong coding experience, development background with experience in solution and designing.
  • Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Visual Basic and Java
  • Ability to extract, transform, and load data with a variety of data types. Skills in any ETL toolsets.
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders

Nice-to-have:

  • Integration experience on SAAS products.
  • Strong Proficiency with Excel, Building complex models & macros in excel

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Associate Director, Surveillance Calibration, Analytics & Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Surveillance Calibration, Analytics & Reporting

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be a part of a global team that is responsible for developing, enhancing and maintaining the framework and methodologies relating to surveillance calibration, validation and optimization, analytics and reporting. Also Responsible for executing these framework elements.


What will you do?

•    Execution of standards for surveillance scenario calibration, validation, and reporting.
•    Responsible for performing scenario calibration and re-calibration employing statistical analysis and other quantitative measurements to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of surveillance alerts.
•    Perform validation and effectiveness reviews of various trade surveillances that involves an assessment of business specifications, regulatory coverage, product coverage, design implementation, etc.
•    Coordinate with Regional Heads of Surveillance to and Regional Surveillance Leads to review quantitative output from calibrations and effectiveness reviews and to overlay qualitative elements to optimize scenarios and improve alert productivity.
•    Responsible for conceiving and developing (or working with Technology develop) Surveillance metric dashboards and reporting packs for internal (Surveillance team) and external publication that involves performance, operational and risk metrics.
•    Contribute to the continuous improvement of the operating model for surveillance calibration, validation, optimization, analytics and reporting.
•    Identify areas of improvement based on the calibration and validation findings and other key inputs


What do you need to succeed?
 

Must-have

-    Solid Trade Surveillance experience 
-    Smarts and/or First Derivatives knowledge
-    Strong knowledge of market abuse
-    Knowledge of financial services regulations
-    Time management and organisational skills and able to work collaboratively with a global team. 
 -    Ability to conduct duties expediently, aptitude for accuracy, attention to detail, and hands-on approach
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Nice-to-have

-    Buy side experience
-    Tableau desktop experience
-    Calibration of Surveillance scenarios experience
-    Ideally educated to a degree level with a relevant degree and/or hold a recognised relevant professional qualification.

What is in it for you?


We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


•    A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
•    Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
•    Opportunities to work with the best in the field
•    Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
•    Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
•    A world-class training program in financial services
•    Flexible working options fully supported.

item.title: VP/Senior Manager- Cash Management Product Pricing and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

VP/Senior Manager- Cash Management Product Pricing and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The role will develop and oversee the pricing strategy of payment products for US cash management. Collaborating with sales and product partners and utilizing an agile delivery approach, the incumbent will develop payments pricing proposals across a suite of payment products (e.g. Fedwire/ ACH/FX etc.) and formulate pricing strategies to support optimization of revenues, while having a strong pulse on client needs, industry trends and competitor landscape

US Cash Management USCM) Business is a unique opportunity to build the cash management business of the future from the ground up. This is an exciting time to join a start-up function within RBC, built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling RBC to compete with new entrants in this space!

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with Sales and Product partners to develop comprehensive payments pricing proposals, subject to senior management approval
  • Develop a relationship pricing approach to increase market share and revenues while focusing on client profitability.
  • Conduct competitive analysis and gather market intelligence to inform pricing strategy.
  • Manage relationships with Solutions-based clients and achieve revenue growth.
  • Develop client strategy reviews and plans in consultation with relevant stakeholders.
  • Achieve business plan by executing individual and regional sales plans and delivering business advice and new insights to clients.
  • Work on cash management models to simulate deal economics based on different KPIs and identify potential re-pricing/up-pricing opportunities to optimize portfolio profitability

People Leadership & Collaboration

  • Selects, builds, and leads a high performing deposits pricing team, leveraging individual capabilities and strengths
  • Provides coaching, mentoring and professional development that further embeds the right culture, values, and leadership behaviors
  • Works with team members to establish goals, drive performance management, support career development and reward strong performance.
  • Ability to forge strong relationships and routines with cross functional partners to drive strong business outcomes 

What you need to succeed?

  • At least 5 years of experience in the financial industry, with preference in Cash Management or Transaction Banking.
  • In-depth knowledge of payment products such as SWIFT, Fedwire, ACH, RTP or FX
  • Familiarity with innovative technologies and current technology trends, particularly in the digital product space such as host to host, API, SWIFT, and TMS/ERP integration
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to see tasks through to completion without significant guidance
  • A "can do" attitude and a client-centric mindset in product design
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate to all project members and stakeholders
  • Experience to deliver significant business results and managing projects from scoping to conclusion, while consistently keeping the client’s goals in mind.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $150,000- $200,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Regular

2023-04-04

item.title: Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech

Job Description


RBC has made the strategic decision to become a Disruptor in the U.S. Cash Management space. By starting this journey, there is a significant opportunity to evolve and capitalize on a $100 Billion Dollar market segment in the U.S. In support of this vision, RBC aims to offer a frictionless, embedded payment and liquidity experience for its clients.  While RBC has an established Cash Management business in Canada, the U.S. based group will be built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling the Bank to compete with new entrants in this space.

What is the opportunity?

The US Cash Management (USCM) Technology team is undertaking a green field project to build a brand-new system to serve corporate clients. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall collection, accuracy, and reporting of USCM Tech initiatives. ​

Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements. Applies advanced in-depth and/or broad knowledge, considered a top resource across the organization.


What will you do?

  • Reporting and Shared Knowledge:
    • Manage the USCM Tech reporting calendar
    • Prepare routine internal portfolio reporting for team leadership on initiative status (financials, risks, benefits)
    • Coordinate portfolio reporting to senior executives (incl. T&O, Group Heads, Board of Directors, etc.)
    • Administer and maintain tools environment for enterprise reporting on behalf of USCM Tech team
    • Ensure consistent reporting processes, approach and tools are in place (factoring in regional differences)
    • Update tools and sites to support shared knowledge and ensure adherence and use of standardized tools and process
  • Data Analytics
    • Subject Matter Expert on gathering development of reporting tools, quality control and measurement of data.
    • Responsible for bringing leading industry best practices into reporting and analytics design solutions for USCM Tech to the table for senior management to review
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvements
  • Relationship and Communication
    • Provides executives and senior management with timely updates on project issues and manages communications including status reports
    • Effectively communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups across USCM using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close
    • Interacts with executives and senior management on the full range of matters related to USCM Tech reporting and analytics
  • Operational Risk, Compliance and Audits
    • Ensures operational risk activities are effectively managed and addressed.
    • Proactively monitors and ensures risk management deadlines are met and issues resolved on a timely basis.

Must have:

  • Experience with financial operations
  • 7+ years of project management experience with at least 3-5 years’ experience with large projects portfolios
  • Demonstrated data analytic & reporting experience
    • Experience using Tableau, SharePoint, Microsoft Office suite, JIRA and Confluenence
  • Strong client-focus and responsiveness to business needs
    • Experience in dashboard development
  • Well-developed communication and presentation skills including executive interaction

Nice to have:

  • PMP Certified or equivalent
  • Basic financial accounting knowledge
  • Exposure to financial services and/or financial products.

What\'s in It for You?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Positive work culture emphasizing diversity and inclusion, volunteerism, and community involvement
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including great benefits, annual incentive program and recognition
  • Leaders who support your development
  • A dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and grow your career
  • Work-life integration
